intro: Oxyacantha crus-galli, commonly known as the red borage, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Oxyacantha crus-galli is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
